title: Laure Neumayer
text: Laure Neumayer (born 1973) is a French political scientist. She is a <a href="Academic%20ranks%20in%20France">maîtresse de conférences</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20Paris%201%20Pantheon-Sorbonne">University of Paris 1 Pantheon-Sorbonne</a> and a senior researcher of the Centre européen de sociologie et de science politique in Paris. She is particularly known for her work on the <a href="politics%20of%20memory">politics of memory</a>, especially related to <a href="post-communist">post-communist</a> states in Central Europe. Her early work focused on the <a href="enlargement%20of%20the%20European%20Union">enlargement of the European Union</a> and the <a href="Europeanization">Europeanization</a> of Central European states, and she has written on <a href="Euroscepticism">Euroscepticism</a>.
